_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary

Facility:  Golden Furrow Fertilizer, Inc.   Fairfield, IA  52556
Contact: Bruce Hollander
Phone:   641-472-5262

1. Facility Policy.

   The owner, management, and employees of Golden Furrow Fertilizer, Inc., Inc.are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Jefferson County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2. Facility Information.

   The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.


 3. Accidental Release Prevention Program.

   The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia."  and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.   The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form, see Section 8.3 (b).

4. Five-Year Accident History.

   There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused
any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility, nor to our knowledge, has there been
any accidental releases resulting on off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or 
environmental damage.

5. Emergency Action Plan.

The facility has:
a.    A written action plan,  in accourdance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;
 
b.    Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know
    information as required under SARA Tiltle III (EPCRA);
 
c.    If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required resp

onse action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers.  With-in 15 minutes of determining the amount of the release would be over 100 pounds, the Emergency Coordinator will notify:
       
    1.  The National Emergency Response Center at 800/424-8802

d.   Any releases in Iowa should be reported to the Iowa Department of Natural Resources at 515/281-8694.


6. Planned Chages to Improve Safety.

   Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions at Golden Furrow Fertilizer, Inc.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
